visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly sales performance across product categories using categorical comparison
visualization_explanation: The visualization presents a 4-month categorical comparison of three product lines using a column chart. The dataset contains three series (Product A/B/C) with four temporal observations each, representing ordinal month categories. While synthetic, the data maintains proportional relationships between products (A > B > C) and shows plausible monthly fluctuations (±20%). The column chart was selected for direct categorical comparisons, maximizing data-ink ratio through clear value encoding in height. Cairo's principles are applied through consistent color associations (warm red for top performer), proportional width spacing, and aligned baseline. Color choices (#FF6384, #36A2EB, #FFCE56) provide sufficient perceptual distance for categorical discrimination. The dark blue typography (#003366) creates hierarchy while maintaining accessibility.
